definition: front/forward/ahead/first/top (followed by a number)/future/ago/before/BC (e.g. 前293年)/former/formerly
lit. one arrow, two golden eagles (idiom)/to kill two birds with one stone

lit. once you've shot the arrow, there's no getting it back (idiom)/fig. once you started sth, there's no turning back/to have to finish what one started/to be determined to reach one's goals in spite of setbacks
pinyin: kai1 gong1 mei2 you3 hui2 tou2 jian4

definition: with one's heart set on speeding home (idiom)

sentences.english: He is shot the injury by a rocket.
The arrow with Hydra’s blood shot through Nemean’s heart.
sentences.chinese: 那浸着许的毒血的箭一下子射进了阿尼破碎的心。

sentences.english: And to accept that - to quote him - "it shoots, it hits".
sentences.chinese: 引用作者的话，便是，箭在射，箭打中了靶心。

sentences.english: And to accept that - to quote him - "it shoots, it hits".
sentences.chinese: 引用作者的话，便是，箭在射，箭打中了靶心。

sentences.english: Cupid shot the leaden -pointed arrow straight at Daphne's heart.
sentences.chinese: 邱比特举起那支铅头的箭，对准戴芙妮的心射过去。

sentences.english: When Sun Quan reached the city walls, arrows rained down on him, and one struck his plumed helmet.
sentences.chinese: 权自到城下看时，城上箭如雨发，射中孙权麾盖。

sentences.english: I hold the Cupid's arrow chasing you, you're wearing a bulletproof vest to fly.
sentences.chinese: 我举着丘比特的箭追呀追，你穿着防弹背心飞呀飞。

sentences.english: The arrow went straight and hit the eye of the bird.
sentences.chinese: 箭笔直的飞出去，正中小鸟的那只眼睛。

sentences.english: An arrow would be useless without a bow and an archer.
sentences.chinese: 没有弓和弓箭手，一支箭是不会有用的。

sentences.english: Pang shot an arrow at Guan who was unable to dodge it.
sentences.chinese: 庞德取箭，关羽躲闪不及中箭，回营养伤。

sentences.english: A short, heavy arrow with a thick head, used especially with a crossbow.
sentences.chinese: 一种发自石弓的四面刃头的箭。

sentences.english: In his hands he held a bow and arrows.
sentences.chinese: 他手持一张弓和一些箭。

sentences.english: I will heap mischiefs upon them; I will spend mine arrows upon them.
sentences.chinese: 我要将祸患堆在他们身上，把我的箭向他们射尽。

sentences.english: One who gives false witness against his neighbour is a hammer and a sword and a sharp arrow.
sentences.chinese: 作假见证陷害邻舍的，就是大槌，是利刀，是快箭。

sentences.english: How is strange, his arrow is all agonic.
sentences.chinese: 奇怪呀，他的箭一点都不偏。

sentences.english: It represents a 28% premium over Wrigley 's current share price.
sentences.chinese: 购并金额是箭牌目前每股股值溢价28%。

definition: a bow (weapon)/CL:張|张[zhang1]/to bend/to arch (one's back etc)
spring-loaded arrow concealed in one's sleeve
